question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Arvid Hammar's employer in 2015?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

Title: The Unseen Threads of Innovation: Unraveling the Story of Arvid Hammar and AAC Omnisys

In the bustling city of Gothenburg, Sweden, where the majestic Göta älv River meets the North Sea, a tale of innovation and collaboration unfolded. At the heart of this narrative lies the story of Arvid Hammar, a researcher whose work left an indelible mark on the world of technology. This is the story of how Arvid Hammar's path intersected with that of AAC Omnisys, a company that would become synonymous with cutting-edge solutions. Chapter 1: The Early Years of Arvid Hammar

Arvid Hammar's fascination with technology began at a young age. Growing up in Sweden, he was surrounded by a culture that valued innovation and design. As a curious and inquisitive individual, Arvid spent countless hours tinkering with gadgets and machinery, laying the foundation for his future as a researcher. His academic pursuits took him to the prestigious Chalmers University of Technology, where he earned a degree in Electrical Engineering. This solid educational background would serve as the springboard for his future endeavors. Chapter 2: The Rise of AAC Omnisys

In the early 2000s, Gothenburg witnessed the emergence of AAC Omnisys, a company that would soon become a powerhouse in the technology sector. Founded by a group of visionary entrepreneurs, AAC Omnisys set out to revolutionize the way businesses approached innovation. With a focus on research and development, the company attracted top talent from across the globe, including Arvid Hammar. Chapter 3: The Intersection of Paths

Arvid Hammar's expertise in electrical engineering and his passion for innovation made him an attractive candidate for AAC Omnisys. In 2005, he joined the company as a researcher, bringing with him a wealth of knowledge and a keen eye for detail. This marked the beginning of a fruitful collaboration that would yield groundbreaking results. Evidence 1: A 2005 press release from AAC Omnisys announcing the appointment of Arvid Hammar as a researcher, highlighting his expertise in electrical engineering and his role in driving innovation within the company. Chapter 4: The Fruit of Collaboration

Arvid Hammar's tenure at AAC Omnisys was marked by a series of innovative projects that pushed the boundaries of technology. One such project, codenamed "Eclipse," aimed to develop a more efficient and sustainable energy harvesting system.
content.source_2: In the year 2030, the world was on the cusp of a new era of technological advancement. Cities were transforming into hubs of innovation, and institutions of higher learning were at the forefront of this revolution. Amidst this backdrop, Arvid Hammar, a brilliant and ambitious researcher, began his tenure at the City College of New York, a senior college of the City University of New York. As Arvid stepped onto the campus, he was struck by the vibrant energy of the students and faculty. The college was abuzz with excitement, as researchers and scientists from various disciplines converged to tackle the most pressing challenges of the 21st century. Arvid, with his expertise in cutting-edge fields like artificial intelligence and biotechnology, was eager to contribute to this collective effort. Over the next thirteen years, Arvid worked tirelessly, collaborating with colleagues and mentoring students as they delved into the mysteries of the universe. He was a driving force behind several groundbreaking projects, including the development of sustainable energy sources and advanced medical treatments. His work earned him recognition and accolades, both within the academic community and beyond. As the years passed, Arvid witnessed the transformation of the city around him. The once-gritty streets of New York gave way to sleek, futuristic skyscrapers and self-driving cars. Virtual reality became an integral part of daily life, and people from all walks of life flocked to the city to experience the latest innovations. Despite the rapid pace of change, Arvid remained committed to his work, driven by a passion for discovery and a desire to make a lasting impact. He formed lasting bonds with his colleagues, and together, they pushed the boundaries of human knowledge. In 2043, after thirteen remarkable years, Arvid's tenure at City College of New York came to a close. As he looked back on his accomplishments, he felt a sense of pride and fulfillment. He had played a small part in shaping the future, and he knew that his work would continue to inspire generations to come. As Arvid departed the campus, he gazed out at the towering skyscrapers, the hum of the city's machinery, and the bright, shining lights of the future. He knew that the world was on the cusp of a new era, and he was grateful to have been a part of it.
